Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to xamarin/monodroid/master@bc0323d" (#3286) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Closed issue ""Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR)" native fault during C# exception handling on ARM64 devices" (#3112) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Debug app on device
2. App deploys
3. App tries to launch but crashes immediately

### Expected Behavior
No crash

### Actual Behavior
App crashes immediately when trying to debug on target device.

### Version Information

1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Remove nl.c from libmonodroid.so builds" (#3287) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: A bug in mono required changing the signature of CreateNLSocket and CloseNLSocket, and now that those are icalls on Android this is the easiest way to enable changing the signature.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump to xamarin/monodroid/master@bc0323d" (#3286) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened issue "[Bug] Setting ControlTemplate on ContentPage from an implicit style results in blank content" (#6657) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

When setting a control template on ContentPage using an implicitly applied style the ContentPresenter appears blank.

The attached reproduction sample exhibits a completely blank ContentPresenter, however in my larger solution the result I get is slightly more subtle - The content presenter seems to work but Xaml bindings elements stop working. Originally noticed the issue due to similar symptoms described in #2146.
[ControlTemplateBinding.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3328300/ControlTemplateBinding.zip)


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a style that applies to your ContentPage type (without an x:Key declaration)
2. Apply a control template using the style

### Expected Behavior

The content of the page is visible in place of the <ContentPresenter> element

### Actual Behavior

Blank space

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.6+ (including 4.0.0.497661)
- Last known good version: none
- IDE: VS2019
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: 9.0<!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: 28.0.0.1 <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy Tab Active 2 (Android 8.1, Sumsung Experience 9.5)

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

[<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->]
Reproduction case: [ControlTemplateBinding.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3328305/ControlTemplateBinding.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Change Query to WaitForElement" (#6588) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
- for test Issue1733 it should be using WaitForElement instead of Query so that it actually waits for it to become visible.
- renamed test so that the name is immediately useful

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "TextRectForBounds does not work >3.6.0.264807" (#6656) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- ð¨ STOP ð¨ ð¦ð§ð¢ð£ ð¨ ðºð»ð¶ð· ð¨ -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create custom LabelRender:
```
using Xamarin.Forms.Platform.iOS;
using ScanDesigner.Models;
using Xamarin.Forms;
using UIKit;
using CoreGraphics;
using System;
using ScanDesigner.iOS;

[assembly: ExportRenderer(typeof(RoundedLabel), typeof(RoundedLabelRenderer))]

namespace ScanDesigner.iOS
{
    public class TagUiLabel : UILabel
    {

        private UIEdgeInsets EdgeInsets = new UIEdgeInsets(10, 5, 10, 5);
        private UIEdgeInsets InverseEdgeInsets = new UIEdgeInsets(-10, -5, -10, -5);

        public override CoreGraphics.CGRect TextRectForBounds(CoreGraphics.CGRect bounds, nint numberOfLines)
        {
            var textRect = base.TextRectForBounds(EdgeInsets.InsetRect(bounds), numberOfLines);
            return InverseEdgeInsets.InsetRect(textRect);
        }       
        public override void DrawText(CoreGraphics.CGRect rect)
        {
            base.DrawText(EdgeInsets.InsetRect(rect));
        }
    }
    public class RoundedLabelRenderer : LabelRenderer
    {    
        protected override void OnElementChanged(ElementChangedEventArgs<Label> e)
        {
            if (Control == null)
            {
                SetNativeControl(new TagUiLabel());
            }
            base.OnElementChanged(e);                    
            if (e.NewElement != null)
            {
                this.Layer.CornerRadius = 10;
                this.Layer.BorderColor= ColorExtensions.ToCGColor(ColorExtensions.ToColor(UIColor.FromRGB(3, 169, 244))); 
                this.Layer.BackgroundColor = ColorExtensions.ToCGColor(Color.GhostWhite);
                this.Layer.BorderWidth = 1;
            }
        }    
    }  
}
```
2. Update Xamarin.Forms above 3.6.0.264807

3. Run

### Expected Behavior
![IMG_0288 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36250590/60151417-0c21e980-97b3-11e9-8ee7-e2b79bcedba3.PNG)

### Actual Behavior
TextRectForBounds does not work.
The text is not shown in multilines, cutting the content.
### Environment

1.
Visual Studio: Help > About Microsoft Visual Studio > Copy Info [button]
Visual Studio for Mac: Visual Studio > About Visual Studio > Show Details > Copy Information [button]
2. Paste into the code block below (between ```)
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Enhancement] Change CollectionView SelectionMode to 4 modes" (#6630) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary
Currently CollectionView SelectionMode has three states
{None,
 Single,
 Multiple
} 


UWP have four selection mode state
{
 None,
Single
Multiple,
Extend,
}
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25994449/59890094-e935b500-9401-11e9-8880-f7a20a404245.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25994449/59890104-fbafee80-9401-11e9-93cd-bfd714f13b9c.png)

I think Four state in Android and IOS are also useful
Just take a look at the File explorer
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25994449/59890457-8ba26800-9403-11e9-95ff-bb81dee57716.png)


## API Changes

{None,
 Single,
 Multiple
} 
To 
{
 None,
Single
Multiple,
Extended,
}




## My willing
I am happy to implent this feature in UWP side.
Will keep IOS and Android not supported

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] Invalid value appears in year picker portion of DatePicker when hovered over with Inspect" (#6655) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
When viewing the DatePicker's accessibilty data with [Inspect](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/winauto/inspect-objects), an invalid value appears above the first (earliest) year value.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run inspect.exe
2. Open the DatePicker control
3. Scroll to the earliest year value
3a. If already at the earliest year value, hover over adjacent values
4. Observe a value appeared above the year values.

### Expected Behavior
The DatePicker remains unchanged when viewing accessibility data.

### Actual Behavior
A value appeared above the year values.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version: N/A
- IDE: Visual Studio 2019
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - UWP:  17134
- Affected Devices: UWP

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13911774/60142317-17065b00-976e-11e9-9302-f022b5e79600.png)
[DatePickerBug.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3327674/DatePickerBug.zip)


### Reproduction Link

Zipped file below with a DatePicker.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Split up Issue4597 into separate testable chunks" (#6654) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
This splits out all the individual parts being tested by Issue4597 so it's more reliable and failures are more indicative of what's actually failing. Also it's way less confusing now to read. 

UWP tests are currently commented out and Issues is logged here
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/6653

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[UWP] Image Loading issues with URI images" (#6653) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
- Images aren't loading when using a URI
- Images and Buttons don't scale down when the image is nulled out

On a side note I think there's a bug with Appium where it can't read an AutomationID from a DataTemplate. Which is one of the reasons that the Issue4597 test is failing on UWP and I have no idea how to currently make it automated. Even if you retrieve the descendants of the ListView it only returns a single empty element so I think the Appium concept of the UI Test isn't refreshing correctly and a bug will need to be logged with them

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run Issue4597 and go through the variations there to test UWP
2. You can also uncomment out the UI tests for windows and run them to see where they fail

### Expected Behavior
All the UI tests for 4597 should pass 

### Actual Behavior
They all currently fail

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0+
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - UWP

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[coremotion] Update for Xcode 11 beta 1" (#6419) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
No change in beta 2

This enable some API in macOS. Headers are now present and some types are
marked as unavailable on macOS - but, sadly, nothing got marked as new
for 10.15 :|
